p: Oregano ( Origanum vulgare) is an aromatic, medicinal, and condiment herb belonging to the Lamiaceae family, commonly occurring throughout Asia, Europe, and northern Africa. In Lithuania, O. vulgare grows in the wild [ 1]. It is a perennial herb with a hairy stem up to 50 cm high and has oval leaves and purple flowers [ 2]. Recently, this plant has drawn more attention from consumers due to the antimicrobial, antifungal, insecticidal, and antioxidative effects of this herb on human health. However, oregano is most important as a culinary herb, used for its flavor around the world [ 2, 3].
